thread.title_full: Flights connecting Kathmandu-Colombo to be launched soonTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Flights connecting Kathmandu-Colombo to be launched soonTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Flights connecting Kathmandu-Colombo to be launched soon Published on : Tuesday, September 8, 2015
As part of expanding their wings and facilitating their governments’ plans of connectivity among all South Asian countries, the Nepal Airlines Corporation (NAC) and Sri Lanka’s Mihin Lanka Airlines plan to start Kathmandu-Colombo flights.
The Kathmandu-Colombo flights will resume after obtaining permission from Nepal’s tourism ministry for which the NAC has already applied, NAC managing director Sugat Ratna Kansakar said. Mihin Lanka, too, has already obtained permission to start its flights.
Sri Lanka is Nepal’s fourth largest source country of tourists.
According to statistics of Nepal Tourism Board, some 37,546 Sri Lankan nationals visited Nepal for pilgrimage and tourism purpose in 2014.
The NAC stopped flying to Colombo since 1979 for security reasons due mainly to civil war in Sri Lanka.
